Data Fields
vpsissIsifVfdcConfig Struct Reference

VFDC config / control structure. Used to enable / disable and configure VFDC. More...

#include <vps_cfgisif.h>

Data Fields

vpsissIsifVfdcMethod_t mode
 
uint32_t shiftUp
 
uint32_t correctAbovePixels
 
uint32_t satVal
 
uint32_t subtractValues [3U][VPS_ISS_ISIF_VFDC_MAX_PIX_CORR]
 
uint32_t numPixToBeCorrected
 
uint32_t defectivePixCoOr [2U][VPS_ISS_ISIF_VFDC_MAX_PIX_CORR]
 

Detailed Description

VFDC config / control structure. Used to enable / disable and configure VFDC.

Field Documentation

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::correctAbovePixels

A non zero values indicated pixels that are above defective pixels would also be corrected. Applicable to all modes of operation

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::defectivePixCoOr[2U][VPS_ISS_ISIF_VFDC_MAX_PIX_CORR]

Defined co-ordinates of defective pixels. A defective pixel location is to be defined as defectivePixCoOr[0][n] = V co-ordinate defectivePixCoOr[1][n] = H co-ordinate Should always start from left to right. Maximum of 8 defects could be corrected

vpsissIsifVfdcMethod_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::mode

Mode of VFDC operation. When mode is != VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_DISABLE The configuration below would be applied and module is functional Otherwise module is disabled.

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::numPixToBeCorrected

Configure the number of pixels to be corrected. It should not be > 7

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::satVal

Specify the number that marks begining values of saturated pixels. i.e. pixel value >= satVal will be considered treated saturated. valid values are 0 - 4095

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::shiftUp

Controls shifting up (left shift) of defective pixel values before subtracting with defined levels. This is not applicable when mode is VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_1_HAVG. Valid values are between 0 - 6.

uint32_t vpsissIsifVfdcConfig::subtractValues[3U][VPS_ISS_ISIF_VFDC_MAX_PIX_CORR]

Applicable when mode is != VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_1_HAVG. Specify the values that are to be subtracted for defective pixels subtractValues [0][n] - For defective pixels subtractValues [1][n] - For pixels that are above defective pixels subtractValues [2][n] - for pixels that are below defective pixels. Valid rage 0 - 255
